original: catuṣpariṣat sūtram
analyzed: catuṣpariṣad sūtram
translated: The Sutra of the Fourfold Assembly

original: bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ vihāraṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyuktoviharati
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām vihāram nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: The Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, was dwelling in a monastery on the bank of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly diligent, discerning, and devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening.

original: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme ṛddhiviṣayajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittaṃ abhinirnāmayatyanekavidham ṛddhiviṣayaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme ṛddhi viṣaya jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati anekavidham ṛddhi viṣayam pratyanubhavati
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the range of psychic powers, and experienced various kinds of psychic powers.

original: tadyathā eko bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā ekaḥ bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati
translated: For example, he became one and then many,

original: bahudhā bhūtvā eko bhavati /
analyzed: bahudhā bhūtvā ekaḥ bhavati
translated: many and then one.

original: āvirbhavati tirobhāvaṃ jñānadarśanena pratyanubhavati /🔽tiraskuḍyaṃ tiraḥśailaṃ tiraḥprākāram asajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tadyathā ākāśe pṛthivyām unmajjananimajjanaṃ karoti tadyathā udake /🔽udake asajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tadyathā pṛthivyām /
analyzed: āvirbhavati tirobhāvam jñāna darśanena pratyanubhavati  tiraskuḍyam tiras śailam tiras prākāram a sajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tat yathā ākāśe pṛthivyām unmajjana nimajjanam karoti tat yathā udake  udake a sajyamānaḥ kāyena gacchati tat yathā pṛthivyām
translated: He manifested and disappeared, and experienced with knowledge and insight.🔽He passed unhindered through walls, through enclosures, through mountains, as if through space. He dived in and out of the earth as if in water.🔽He walked on water without sinking as if on earth.

original: ākāśe paryaṃgena vikramate tadyathā pakṣi śakuniḥ /
analyzed: ākāśe paryaṃgena vikramate tat yathā pakṣi śakuniḥ
translated: He traveled cross-legged through the air like a bird on the wing.

original: imāvapi candrasūryau evaṃ mahardhikau evaṃ mahānubhāvau pāṇinā āmārjati parimārjayati yāvad brahmalokādapi kāyena vaśe vartayati /
analyzed: imau api candra sūryau evam mahardhikau evam mahā anubhāvau pāṇinā āmārjati parimārjayati yāvat brahma lokāt api kāyena vaśe vartayati
translated: And he touches with his hand, and even strokes with his hand, the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful, and he exercises mastery with his body as far as the Brahma world.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣū dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto viharaṃ rātryāḥ prathame yāme anekavidham ṛddhiviṣayaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ prathame yāme anekavidham ṛddhi viṣayam pratyanubhavati
translated: Thus the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, while dwelling in Urubilvā on the banks of the Nairañjanā River, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly and carefully dwelling in the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening, in the first watch of the night experienced various kinds of supernormal power.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, while dwelling in Urubilvā as before, dwelt devoted to meditation.

original: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsānusmṛtijñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati so'nekavidhaṃ pūrvenivāsaṃsamanusmarati /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsa anusmṛti jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati saḥ u nekavidham
translated: In the first watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of recollecting past lives, and he remembered various kinds of past lives.

original: tadyathaikāṃ jātiṃ dve tisraścatasraḥ yāvad anekānapi saṃvartakalpān samanusmarati /
analyzed: tat yathā ekām jātim dve tisraḥ catasraḥ yāvat anekān api saṃvarta kalpān samanusmarati
translated: Namely, he remembered one birth, two, three, four, up to many eons of world-dissolution.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavāṃ uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto viharaṃ rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsaṃ samanusmarati /
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ prathame yāme pūrvenivāsam samanusmarati
translated: Thus, the Blessed Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā on the bank of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly diligent, discerning, devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening, in the first watch of the night recollects his former abodes.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then, the Blessed Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā as before... is devoted to the practice of meditation.

original: sa rātryā madhyame yāme divyaśrotrajñānasākṣīkriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhenātikrāṃtamānuṣeṇaubhayām śṛṇoti mānuṣāṃśca ye vā dūre ye vāntike /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya śrotra jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhena atikrāṃta mānuṣeṇa aubhayām śṛṇoti mānuṣān ca ye vā dūre ye vā antike
translated: In the middle watch of the night, he directs his mind to the realization of the supernormal knowledge of the divine ear. With the divine ear, which is purified and surpasses the human, he hears both kinds of sounds, divine and human, whether far or near.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairañjanāyāstīre bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto viharaṃ rātryā madhyame yāme divyaśrotrajñānaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairañjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pākṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya śrotra jñānam pratyanubhavati
translated: Thus, the Blessed Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā on the bank of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, constantly diligent, discerning, devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening, in the middle watch of the night experiences the divine ear.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān uruvilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān uruvilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā... as before... was dwelling in earnest.

original: sa rātryā madhyame yāme divyacakṣurjñānasākṣīkriyāyā vidyāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati /🔽divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānānapyupapadyamānānapi suvarṇānapi durvarṇānapi hīnānapi praṇītānapi sugatimapi gacchato durgatimapi yathākarmopagān sattvān yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya cakṣuḥ jñāna sākṣīkriyāyāḥ vidyāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati  divyena cakṣuṣā viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣeṇa sattvān paśyati cyavamānān api upapadyamānān api suvarṇān api durvarṇān api hīnān api praṇītān api sugatim api gacchataḥ durgatim api yathā karma upagān sattvān yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: In the middle watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the knowledge of the divine eye.🔽With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he saw beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he knew how beings fare in accordance with their kamma:🔽These worthy beings, who are endowed with bodily good conduct, verbal good conduct, and mental good conduct, who do not revile noble ones, who hold right views and undertake actions based on right views, because of these causes and conditions, at the breaking up of the body after death, are reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: itīme bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāyaduścaritena samanvāgatā vāṅmanoduścaritena samanvāgatā āryāṇām apavādakā mithyādṛṣṭayo mithyādṛṣṭikarmadharmasamādānahetostaddhetostatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedāt paraṃ maraṇād apāyadurgativinipātam narakeṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: iti ime bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ vāc manaḥ duścaritena samanvāgatāḥ āryāṇām apavādakāḥ mithyādṛṣṭayaḥ mithyādṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ tad hetoḥ tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgati vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyante
translated: But these worthy beings, who are endowed with bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct, who revile noble ones, who hold wrong views and undertake actions based on wrong views, because of these causes and conditions, at the breaking up of the body after death, are reborn in a lower realm, an evil destination, a bad destination, hell.

original: ime vā punarbhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāyasucaritena samanvāgatā vāṅmanaḥsucaritena samanvāgatā āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyagdṛṣṭayaḥ samyagdṛṣṭikarmadharmasamādānahetostaddhetostatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svargaloke deveṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: ime vā punar bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ kāya su caritena samanvāgatāḥ vāc manaḥ su caritena samanvāgatāḥ āryāṇām anapavādakāḥ samyak dṛṣṭayaḥ samyak dṛṣṭi karma dharma samādāna hetoḥ tad hetoḥ tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt sugatau svarga loke deveṣu upapadyante
translated: Or, these beings, endowed with good bodily, verbal, and mental conduct, not disparaging the noble ones, having right view, due to undertaking actions and dharmas with right view, for that reason and that condition, at the break-up of the body, are reborn in a good realm, in heaven, among the gods.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairaṃjanāyāstire bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogama anuyukto viharaṃ rātryā madhyame yāme divyacakṣurjñānaṃ pratyanubhavati /
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairaṃjanāyāḥ tire bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogama anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ madhyame yāme divya cakṣuḥ jñānam pratyanubhavati
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā on the bank of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, practicing continuously, being mindful, dwelling engaged in the yoga of meditation on the dharmas that are factors of awakening, in the middle watch of the night, experiences the knowledge of the divine eye.

original: atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yavad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yavat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Then, the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, dwelling in Urubilvā as before, dwells engaged.

original: sa rātryā paścime yāme cetaḥparyāyajñasākṣikriyāya abhijñāyam cittam abhinirnāmayati /
analyzed: sa rātryā paścime yāme cetaḥ paryāya jña sākṣi kriyāya abhijñāyam cittam abhinirnāmayati
translated: In the last watch of the night, he directs his mind to the realization of the knowledge of the bases of psychic power.

original: parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānaṃ vitarkitaṃ vicaritaṃ manasā mānasaṃ yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: para sattvānām para pudgalānam vitarkitam vicaritam manasā mānasam yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it truly is the thoughts and mental states of other beings and persons.

original: sarāgacittaṃ sarāgaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽vigatarāgaṃ vigatarāgaṃ iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa rāga cittam sa rāgam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  vigata rāgam vigata rāgam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with passion as a mind with passion,🔽and a mind without passion as a mind without passion.

original: sadveṣaṃ vigatadveṣaṃ samoham vigatamohaṃ vikṣiptaṃ saṃkṣiptaṃ līnaṃ pragṛhitam
analyzed: sa dveṣam vigata dveṣam sa moham vigata moham vikṣiptam saṃkṣiptam līnam pragṛhitam
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with hatred as a mind with hatred, a mind without hatred as a mind without hatred, a mind with delusion as a mind with delusion, a mind without delusion as a mind without delusion, a contracted mind as a contracted mind, a distracted mind as a distracted mind,

original: uddhataṃ anuddhataṃ avyupaśāntaṃ vyupaśantaṃ samāhitaṃ asamāhitam abhāvitaṃ bhāvitaṃ avimuktaṃ cittam avimuktaṃ cittaṃ iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti
analyzed: uddhatam an uddhatam a vyupaśāntam vyupaśantam samāhitam a samāhitam a bhāvitam bhāvitam a vimuktam cittam a vimuktam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: an exalted mind as an exalted mind, an unexalted mind as an unexalted mind, an unexhausted mind as an unexhausted mind, an exhausted mind as an exhausted mind, an undestroyed mind as an undestroyed mind, and a destroyed mind as a destroyed mind.

original: iti bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairaṃjanāyāstire bodhimūle sātatyakārī nipako bodhipakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanāyogam anuyukto viharaṃ rātryāḥ paścime yāmecetaḥparyāyajñānaṃ pratyanubhavati /🔽atha bodhisattvo bhagavān urubilvāyāṃ viharaṃ pūrvavad yāvad anuyukto viharati /
analyzed: iti bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam nadyāḥ nairaṃjanāyāḥ tire bodhi mūle sātatya kārī nipakaḥ bodhi pakṣikeṣu dharmeṣu bhāvanā yogam anuyuktaḥ viharam rātryāḥ paścime yāme cetaḥ paryāya jñānam pratyanubhavati 🔽atha bodhisattvaḥ bhagavān urubilvāyām viharam pūrvavat yāvat anuyuktaḥ viharati
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, the Bodhisattva, while dwelling in Urubilvā on the banks of the Nairañjanā River at the foot of the Bodhi tree, continuously practicing, mindful, and devoted to the practice of meditation on the factors of awakening, in the last watch of the night experienced the knowledge of the discernment of the mind.

original: sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme āsravakṣayajñānasākṣikriyāyā abhijñāyāṃ cittam abhinirnāmayati /
analyzed: sa rātryāḥ paścime yāme āsrava kṣaya jñāna sākṣi kriyāyāḥ abhijñāyām cittam abhinirnāmayati
translated: In the last watch of the night, he directed his mind to the realization of the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, and to the realization of the supernormal knowledge.

original: idaṃ duḥkham āryasatyam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽ayaṃ duḥkhasamudayaḥ /
analyzed: idam duḥkham ārya satyam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  ayam duḥkha samudayaḥ
translated: He knew as it really is: 'This is the noble truth of suffering.'🔽This is the noble truth of the arising of suffering.

original: ayaṃ duḥkhanirodhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam duḥkha nirodhaḥ
translated: This is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: iyaṃ duḥkhannirodhagāminī pratipad āryasatyam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: iyam duḥkhan nirodha gāminī pratipad ārya satyam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: This is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

original: tasyaivaṃ jānata evaṃ paśyataḥ kāmāsravāccittaṃ vimucyate /
analyzed: tasya evam jānataḥ evam paśyataḥ kāma āsravāt cittam vimucyate
translated: For him, knowing thus, seeing thus, his mind was liberated from the defilement of sensuality,

original: bhavāsravād avidyāsravāccittaṃ vimucyate /
analyzed: bhava āsravāt avidyā āsravāt cittam vimucyate
translated: from the defilement of becoming, from the defilement of ignorance.

original: vimuktasya vimukto'smiīti jñānadarśanaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: vimuktasya vimuktaḥ asmi iti jñāna darśanam bhavati
translated: When it was liberated, there was the knowledge: 'It is liberated.'

original: kṣīṇā me jātiruṣitaṃ brahmacaryaṃ kṛtaṃ karaṇīyaṃ nāparam asmād bhavaṃ prajānāmīti /
analyzed: kṣīṇā me jātiḥ uṣitam brahmacaryam kṛtam karaṇīyam na aparam asmāt bhavam prajānāmi iti
translated: He knew: 'Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.'

original: iti bhagavān urubilvayāṃ viharaṃ nadyā nairaṃjanāyāstīre bodhimūle kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛtakaraṇīyaḥ saṃbuddhabodhis tejodhātuṃ samapannaḥ /
analyzed: iti bhagavān urubilvayām viharam nadyāḥ nairaṃjanāyāḥ tīre bodhi mūle kṛtakṛtyaḥ kṛta karaṇīyaḥ saṃbuddha bodhiḥ tejaḥ dhātum samapannaḥ
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, dwelling at Uruvilvā on the bank of the river Nairañjanā, at the foot of the Bodhi tree, having attained his goal and accomplished his task, the Fully Enlightened One entered into the fire element.
